title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Physicists’ hopes for an exotic muon collider get a boost
items.description: U.S. should plan to build machine to hunt for new subatomic particles, National Academies report says

items.title: Trump’s cuts to more than 1700 NIH grants get court hearing
items.description: District judge could declare terminations unlawful—or toss suit based on technicalities

items.title: Tropical forests are heating up. Can they cope?
items.description: Scientists are pushing plants beyond their comfort zone to test their resilience to warming

items.title: U.K. science funding to remain flat for next 4 years
items.description: Government also announces cash for nuclear, carbon capture, and AI projects

items.title: Climate change threatens India-Pakistan pact over major river system
items.description: Warming world could further heighten tensions over access to Indus River waters

items.title: Historical records expose role of Black inmates in unethical malaria studies decades ago
items.description: Science chats with James Tabery about the overlooked role of Black prisoners in understanding the genetics of drug reactions

items.title: Newly discovered plant genes could slash cost of making key cancer drug
items.description: Shifting production from yew trees to yeast could lead to cheaper synthesis of Taxol precursor

items.title: ‘Dragon prince’ dinosaur may be missing link in T. rex evolution
items.description: Newly described fossils point to ancient movement between Asia and North America

items.title: This brain implant lets a man who lost his speech to ALS produce natural-sounding sentences instantaneously
items.description: New brain-computer interface allows control of intonation, and generates a person’s voice at the speed of typical speech

items.title: Senators press NIH director on killed grants and proposal to slash agency’s funding
items.description: Jay Bhattacharya says NIH’s final budget will be a “collaboration”
